title: Burnley v Liverpool: Premier League – live
summary: Liverpool aims to extend their winning streak as they face Burnley at Turf Moor. A minute-by-minute report will provide updates on the match, spearheaded by John Brewin. Fans can follow the action live as both teams battle for victory.

title: World Athletics Championships 2025: 100m finals, Gressier wins men’s 10,000m – live
summary: Daniel Harris reports live from Tokyo, highlighting an exciting evening filled with medal competitions. Athletes are vying for top honors as the events unfold. Tune in for all the latest updates and results.

title: Scale of ‘Unite the Kingdom’ march shows free speech ‘alive and well’ in UK, says minister – UK politics live
summary: Peter Kyle expressed that he was not "disturbed" by the large far-right protest organized by Tommy Robinson. However, he condemned any violence directed towards the police during the event. His comments highlight a stance against both extremist gatherings and aggression toward law enforcement.

title: ‘I was told I had two weeks to live’ – why are so many young, fit, non-smoking women getting lung cancer?
summary: Lung cancer, traditionally seen as a disease affecting older men who smoke, is increasingly affecting young women, leaving doctors puzzled. The rise in cases prompts speculation about potential causes, including air pollution. This shift in demographics highlights the need for further research into the disease.

title: The super-rich are swapping mansions for £2m motorhomes. Do they know something we don’t? | Emma Beddington
summary: Wealthy individuals choose to spend extended periods in modest settings, likened to Center Parcs, instead of luxurious resorts reminiscent of 'White Lotus.' This behavior reinforces the idea that affluent people often squander their riches. The author sees this as a reflection of how wealth does not always translate into the best experiences.
